summary: This is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing the scheduling of a grand jury regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The emails mention a lack of quorum on April 8, 2008, and indicate that if an indictment does not occur by April 1, it would be delayed until April 15.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The emails are inquiring about updates regarding Epstein, who is the subject of a grand jury investigation. The scheduling of the grand jury is being discussed in relation to a potential indictment.

events.title: Potential Epstein indictment date
events.description: Mentioned as a deadline; if Epstein is not indicted by this date, the grand jury would have to wait until April 15 due to a lack of quorum on April 8.

events.title: Grand jury lacks quorum
events.description: The grand jury investigating Epstein will not have a quorum on this date, affecting the timeline for a potential indictment.

events.title: Next grand jury date after delay
events.description: If an indictment does not occur by April 1, the next opportunity for the grand jury to convene would be on this date.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing the Epstein grand jury investigation in March 2008.
It reveals scheduling issues with the grand jury, specifically a lack of quorum on April 8, 2008, which would delay any indictment until April 15 if not secured by April 1.
The correspondence indicates active communication among prosecutors about the status of the Epstein case at that time.
